channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: China races to contain new outbreak as infections spread beyond Beijing
'Ground-breaking' discovery made for treating Covid-19 patients
item.description: The widely available steroid drug dexamethasone may be key in helping to treat the sickest Covid-19 patients who require ventilation or oxygen, according to researchers in the United Kingdom.

item.title: More than 8 million cases confirmed worldwide
'Ridiculous logic': Anderson Cooper reacts to Trump's remark
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper calls out President Trump over comments he made about coronavirus testing.

item.title: Twenty Indian soldiers dead after clash with China along disputed border
item.description: At least 20 Indian soldiers have died after a "violent face-off" with Chinese troops along the countries' de facto border in the Himalayas late Monday, the Indian army has said.

item.title: Trump defends police while signing muted executive order on reform
item.description: President Donald Trump takes his first concrete steps on Tuesday to address growing national outcry over police brutality when he signs an executive order creating a federal database of police officers with a history of using excessive force.

item.title: Trump brings up black unemployment rate before signing police reform order
Trump isn't aging well
item.description: Donald Trump is not coping well.

item.title: New Mexico Gov. condemns 'would-be militia' after protest turns violent
Black officer fired for intervening when white cop had suspect in chokehold
item.description: Officials in Buffalo, New York, want an investigation into the firing of a black police officer who intervened when a white colleague had a suspect in a chokehold.

item.title: 75-year-old protester shoved by police has fractured skull and can't walk
item.description: Martin Gugino, the 75-year-old protester who was pushed by two Buffalo, New York, police officers earlier this month, has a fractured skull and is not able to walk, his lawyer said in a statement provided to CNN on Monday.

item.title: Author of revealing new book about Melania Trump speaks out
item.description: Mary Jordan, the author of the new book "The Art of Her Deal" about first lady Melania Trump, speaks to CNN's Alisyn Camerota.

item.title: A gang tried to kidnap one of China's richest people. It didn't end well for them
item.description: A home appliance billionaire and one of China's richest people was held hostage with his family for hours in a kidnapping attempt that was reportedly foiled when his son swam across a river to alert police, local media and authorities said.

item.title: 'Brilliant and talented' 16-year-old climber dies following fall
item.description: French climber Luce Douady has died at the age of 16 after falling from a cliff on Sunday, the French Federation of Mountaineering and Climbing (FFME) has said.

item.title: John Bolton's impending book elicits angry reaction from Trump
item.description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

item.title: North Korea blows up office used for talks with South
item.description: North Korea has blown up a joint liaison office used for talks between itself and South Korea, authorities in Seoul confirmed Tuesday, the latest sign that the relationship between the two longtime adversaries is rapidly deteriorating.

item.title: Asylum seekers transferred to small Irish town started testing positive for Covid-19
item.description: Misha was living in a hotel in a leafy suburb of Ireland's capital city under the country's controversial asylum seeker accommodation system when a letter arrived.

item.title: Late-night hosts mock Trump's walk down ramp at West Point
item.description: Late-night hosts mock Donald Trump's slow walk down a ramp at the US Military Academy at West Point.

item.title: Trump indicates he's not budging on reducing number of US troops in Germany
item.description: President Donald Trump indicated on Monday that he's not reconsidering a plan to withdraw thousands of US troops from Germany, despite some Republicans in Congress saying they don't support the move.

item.title: Airlines ban alcohol on planes in response to Covid-19
item.description: Alcohol sales may have boomed during lockdown, but our return to air travel will be an altogether more sobering experience.

item.title: Trump team concerned over release of Bolton's book
item.description: Former national security adviser John Bolton is set to release a book that details his time inside the Trump White House. CNN's Brian Stelter reports on how the White House is determined to stop Bolton.

item.title: CIA cyber weapons stolen in historic breach due to 'woefully lax security'
item.description: The largest theft of data in CIA history happened because a specialized unit within the agency was so focused on building cyber weapons that an employee took advantage of "woefully lax" security and gave secret hacking tools to WikiLeaks, according to an internal report released on Tuesday.

item.title: Buttigieg on LGBTQ ruling: The struggle is not over
item.description: Former Mayor Pete Buttigieg, the first gay candidate for president in the US, talks to CNN's Jim Sciutto about the historic Supreme Court ruling on LGBTQ rights.

item.title: Charges dropped against black pastor who was assaulted; now 5 people are charged with hate crimes
item.description: Five people have been charged with hate crimes in Virginia and the black pastor they are accused of attacking is no longer facing charges for pulling out a gun during the incident.

item.title: NYPD officers hospitalized after drinking Shake Shack milkshakes tainted with bleach
item.description: Three New York City Police Department officers have been released from the hospital after getting sick when they drank milkshakes from Shake Shack Monday night.

item.title: Members of chief's SWAT team resigned after she took a knee. See her response
item.description: Hallandale Beach Police Chief Sonia Quiñones, who took a knee with protesters, responds to the 10 SWAT members who resigned from their unit, saying they felt unsafely restrained by politics.

item.title: Spacecraft captures 'green glow' of Mars
item.description: Mars may be known as the red planet, but a European spacecraft found oxygen that is causing a green glow in the planet's atmosphere, according to a new study.

item.title: Tesla says Model S is the first EV to get 400 miles on a single charge
item.description: Tesla says its Model S Long Range Plus is the first electric vehicle to achieve over 400 miles of EPA-rated range.

item.title: FDA cautions pet owners about infecting their pets in new video
item.description: Pets might not infect people with coronavirus, but pet owners need to protect cats, dogs and other companion animals, the US Food and Drug Administration cautioned in a new YouTube video.

item.title: This Chinese tech giant is building a Monaco-sized 'city of the future'
item.description: Technology giant Tencent has unveiled plans for an almost entirely car-free "city of the future," equivalent in size to Monaco, in the Chinese metropolis of Shenzhen.

item.title: Diego, the tortoise who saved his entire species, finally retires to uninhabited island
item.description: Diego, a libidinous giant tortoise credited with saving his species, has finally retired to an uninhabited island off the coast of Ecuador after decades of service in a breeding program.

item.title: Glass bridge cracks after tourist baseball-slides on it
item.description: A tourist managed to crack the clear glass floor of the largest pedestrian suspension bridge in the United States, forcing the Gatlinburg, Tennessee, landmark to close Monday night for repairs.

item.title: Watch ex-LAPD sergeant's scathing response to NYPD's change
item.description: NYPD police commissioner Dermot Shea announced that the NYPD will reassign 600 plain-clothes officers, which closes one of the last chapters of the controversial "stop and frisk" policy.

item.title: The battle to become Europe's safest holiday destination
Kanye West files trademark for new Yeezy beauty line
item.description: Rapper, fashion designer and potential 2024 presidential candidate Kanye West has his sights on the beauty industry. On June 2, West filed a new trademark with the United States Patent and Trademark Office under the name of his luxury streetwear brand Yeezy, for a host of new products that include makeup and fragrances; skin, hair and nail care products; face and body glitter; baby wipes; and hair removal cream.

item.title: The internet shows Vogue how diverse its covers could look
item.description: People around the world have been re-creating Vogue covers to promote diversity in fashion.

item.title: Soccer star, 22, takes on Boris Johnson over feeding hungry kids -- and wins
item.description: Manchester United and England star Marcus Rashford has written to UK lawmakers urging them them to "put their rivalries aside" and make a U-turn, after Prime Minister Boris Johnson rejected the footballer's plea to extend the free school meal voucher scheme for low-income families.

item.title: Why is Ted Cruz picking a fight with Hellboy?
item.description: "Listen Hellboy."

item.title: You can now pay thousands of dollars to talk to celebrities for 10 minutes
item.description: Some bored and cooped-up celebrities (we're using that term lightly) have apparently hit "Peak Quarantine" are now offering Zoom calls with fans for hundreds -- and even thousands -- of dollars.

item.title: It looks like a photo, but it's a drawing
item.description: You're not alone if you do a double-take when you see one of Arinze Stanley's drawings—his portraits are so lifelike, they are often mistaken for photographs.

item.title: What it's like to play in soccer's 'ghost games'
item.description: If he's always had a knack of expanding his frame to make his goal seem smaller than it really is, Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer is all too aware of how his world has shrunk over the last few months.

item.title: Jennifer Garner explains taking her cat for a walk in a stroller
item.description: One of Jennifer Garner's kids is responsible for their cat riding in style.

item.title: Seeking the hidden treasure of the Rocky Mountains
item.description: In 2010 Forrest Fenn hid a real treasure chest somewhere in the Rockies. The only clues to its whereabouts are in a poem.

item.title: I stayed at a new hotel during the pandemic. Here's what it was like
item.description: In the best of circumstances, opening a hotel tends to be a stressful and money-draining endeavor for any owner, not to mention risky.

item.title: Entire city under soft lockdown and outbound travel tightened to try to contain surge in coronavirus infections
item.description: Authorities in Beijing have imposed a soft lockdown on the entire city, after the Chinese capital reported more than 100 new locally transmitted coronavirus cases in the past five days.

item.title: New Zealand reports first new cases in over 3 weeks
item.description: New Zealand has reported its first coronavirus cases in more than three weeks after two women who traveled to the country from the UK were found to have Covid-19.

item.title: Why Africa's predicted Covid-19 surge hasn't happened
item.description: On January 28, at around one in the morning, Dr. John Nkengasong's cellphone rang in Addis Ababa.

item.title: Trump's wish for end to pandemic contradicts reality
item.description: • Why the Trump-West Point ramp story actually matters

item.title: Police officers across the US are quitting
item.description: • Governor condemns 'would-be militia' after shooting at protest • Trump defends police before signing modest order on reforms • LIVE: What's in Trump's executive order
